items.title: ITI Mutual Fund projects to reach Rs 1 trn AUM in next five years
items.description: ITI MF's asset under management (AUM) increased nearly 2.4 times to Rs 8,791 crore in July 2024 from Rs 3,698 crore in March 2023

items.title: Mutual funds take to factor-based investing; bridging active, passive gap
items.description: Use parameters such as momentum, company size, and volatility to construct portfolios

items.title: Deepak Shenoy's Capitalmind gets in-principle approval for MF foray
items.description: Capitalmind joins the likes of Angel One and Unifi Capital in the queue for a final MF licence

items.title: Market regulator Sebi to release stress test findings on equity MFs
items.description: Fund houses have started publishing their own stress test results for smallcap schemes every fortnight since March, amid concerns of "frothy valuations"

items.title: Red-hot thematic investing theme receives a 'passive' boost in July
items.description: Index funds add 1 million folios in July, 14% of total additions

items.title: Thematic funds emerge as largest MF category; AUM doubles in a year
items.description: Flexicap slips to the second spot, largecap perched fourth

items.title: NFO deluge opens mutual fund investor floodgates wide in July, shows data
items.description: Investor tide swells by 1.2 million, reaching 48.1 million

items.title: Charticle: Mutual funds continue to lap up banking shares in July
items.description: The investment is the aggregate of total net deployment by active equity, passive and equity-oriented hybrid schemes

items.title: Equity MF schemes stockpile cash in response to sky-high valuations
items.description: July sees cash levels climb to 5.4%, up from June's 4.6%

items.title: Focused MFs' asset base rises 31% to Rs 1.43 trillion in April-June qtr
items.description: Focused funds are a type of mutual fund where the fund manager selects a concentrated portfolio of stocks, typically limited to a maximum of 30 due to regulatory constraints

items.title: Equity MF inflow drops 9% to Rs 37k cr in July over drop in fund infusion
items.description: This reflects the growing financial discipline among retail investors, helping them build wealth systematically over time, Venkat Chalasani, Chief Executive, AMFI, said

items.title: India's equity MF inflows ease off record high levels in July, shows data
items.description: The sequential 9.4 per cent drop in July from the previous month was due to profit booking at record high levels

items.title: Mkt regulator Sebi notifies mutual fund norms to prevent market abuse
items.description: Fund houses to put in place whistle-blower policy, top management to shoulder more responsibilities

items.title: CAMS Q1 results: Net profit rises 42% to Rs 108 cr, revenue up 27%
items.description: The company had logged a PAT of Rs 76.34 crore in the year-ago period, Computer Age Management Services Ltd (CAMS) said in a statement

items.title: Mutual fund body Amfi calls for roll back of equity tax, STT hike
items.description: Says higher tax will disrupt financialisation of savings

items.title: Multi-asset allocation funds steal a march on balanced advantage funds
items.description: Since April '23, they've amassed Rs 42,980 crore, leaving BAFs trailing at Rs 14,033 crore

items.title: SBI Mutual Fund launches the Innovative Opportunities Fund: Check details
items.description: The fund will invest up to 35 per cent of the corpus in global stocks as and when the foreign investment limit is raised

items.title: Scaling the economic ladder: Indian savings climb, yet rungs remain
items.description: For instance, only 15 per cent of US households' assets are in banks, compared to 46 per cent in South Korea

items.title: Investment in equity MFs surge 5-fold to Rs 94,151 cr in June quarter
items.description: The robust gain in the asset base was also replicated in the growth of investors in equity mutual funds, with the number of folios closing at 13.3 crore

items.title: MF AUM increases to 29% of bank deposits on equity rally, inflows
items.description: In the financial years ending March 2023 and March 2022, MFs had cornered over 6 per cent of household savings. In FY21, this figure had been a mere 1.3 per cent, according to RBI data
